result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshun J Carver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Court will allow for full huber.

miscConds.notes: Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  The Court will waive what costs, fees and surcharges it is able to based on an inability to pay.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of dangerous weapons, firearms or ammunition.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: In a program related to the following subject matter: alcohol, drugs or violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshun J Carver

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  4 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit. Court will allow for full Huber.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 12 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
-Absolute sobirety
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Maintain employment
-Complete 40 hours of community service in a program related to the following subject matter: alcohol, drugs, or violence
-No possession of dangerous weapons, firearms, or amunition

Appeal rights given.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).  The Court will waive what costs, fees, and surcharges it is able to based on an inabilty to pay.


Filed: 
Documentaion in support of the defendant

Defendant Deshun J Carver in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Deshun J Carver in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial.  Parties request that the case remain scheduled for trial on 09/16/2015 at 8:30am, but requested a plea and sentencing date prior. Plea and sentencing date was selected. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-01-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial is scheduled for 09-16-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Deshun J Carver in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for trial.
Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 45.
Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Deshun J Carver in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Motion hearing proceeded.  Arguments from defense and state heard.  For reasons placed on the record, court DENIED defense motion to dismiss.  Defense requests a status conference date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss, filed.
LETTER FROM KEVIN C. POTTER, ASSISTANT ATTORNEY GENERAL, STATE OF WISCONSIN, DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE received.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Due to Vagueness of the Statutory Regimes Related to Carrying a Concealed Weapon and the Safe Trasport Statute, filed.

Defendant Deshun J Carver in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests a motion hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 46.  All motions are to be filed by 6-5-2015. jks
  Motion hearing scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshun J Carver in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46.  Defense requests 60 days.  jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deshun J Carver in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Deshun J Carver in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
